articles.title: DoSS Summer Prep Bootcamp
articles.description: Website for the Department of Statistical Sciences' Graduate Summer Prep Bootcamp (SPB)
articles.contents:
Overview
Welcome to the course website for the Summer Prep Bootcamp (SPB)
offered by the Department
of Statistical Sciences (DoSS) at the University of Toronto! All
information related to the bootcamp will be posted on this website.
The purpose of DoSS SPB is to get incoming graduate students up to
speed on foundational mathematical, statistical, and computing concepts
in a low pressure environment to prepare for coursework in the upcoming
semester.
Acknowledgements
The following people contributed to the design of the course
materials and website: Prof. Jesse Gronsbell (2022), Robert Zimmerman
(2022), Siyue Yang (2022), Emma Kroell (2022), and Shiki Liu (2022).
Profs. Lei Sun, Radu Craiu, Monica Alexander, Nancy Reid, Dehan Kong,
Linbo Wang, Stanislav Volgushev, Piotr Zwiernik, Nathan Taback, and
Arvind Gupta provided invaluable feedback regarding course content.
DoSS SPB is made possible through the support of Katy Wang, Christine
Bulguryemez, and Angela Fleury - thank you!
Lastly, DoSS SPB is inspired by the preparatory course for incoming
PhD students offered by the Department of Biostatistics at Harvard
University. We thank alum instructor, Prof. Ryan Sun of MD Anderson
Cancer Center, for kindly sharing course materials.
